SourceText: Step 1: Create a parent group in the App
text: Stap 1: Krea un grupo di mayor den e App

SourceText:
This sets up the space where you’ll manage all parents in your group.

1️⃣ Go to _Groups_
2️⃣ Select _Create New Group_
3️⃣ Enter the basic details of the group: group name, age group (young children, teens, or mixed) and delivery format (all remote, with in-person opening or closing, or both)
4️⃣ Save your new group 

👉 This is now the “home” where you’ll manage everything for this parent group.
text:
Esaki ta pone e espasio kaminda bo ta manehá tur mayor den bo grupo.

1️⃣ Bai na _Gruponan_
2️⃣ Selektá _Krea Grupo Nobo_
3️⃣ Hinka e detayenan básiko di e grupo: nòmber di grupo, grupo di edat (mucha yòn, hóben, òf kombiná) i forma di duna e seshonnan (tur hende riba distansia, en persona ku un apertura i klousura òf tur dos)
4️⃣ Warda bo grupo nobo 

👉 Esaki ta awor e “kas” kaminda bo ta manehá tur kos pa e grupo mayor akí.

SourceText: Step 2: Conduct Individual Consultations
text: Etapa 2: Hiba Konsultanan Individual

SourceText:
Before the programme begins, call or message each parent.

Use this time to:
1️⃣ Explain what the programme is about and how it will be delivered (through WhatsApp group sessions and activities at home).
2️⃣ Share what parents can expect each week (videos, home activities, and group chats).
3️⃣ Answer any questions or concerns they may have.
4️⃣ Collect basic information about the parent, their child, and family situation.
5️⃣ Build a friendly and trusting relationship.
6️⃣ Encourage them to participate actively in the WhatsApp group.

💡 Tip: Follow the Individual Consultation Guide for sample questions and key points to cover.
text:
Promé ku e programa kuminsá, yama òf manda un mensahe pa kada mayor.

Usa e tempu akí pa:
1️⃣ Splika kiko e programa ta trata i kon e lo duna esaki (pa medio di seshonnan i aktividatnan di grupo di WhatsApp na kas).
2️⃣ Kompartí loke mayornan por spera tur siman (vidionan, aktividatnan na kas, i kòmbersashon den grupo).
3️⃣ Kontestá kualke pregunta òf prekupashon ku nan por tin.
4️⃣Tuma informashon básiko tokante e mayor, su yu, i situashon di famia.
5️⃣ Konstruí un relashon amistoso i di konfiansa.
6️⃣ Enkurashá nan pa partisipá aktivamente den e grupo di WhatsApp.

💡 Tip: Sigui e Guia di Konsulta Individual pa preguntanan ehèmpel i puntonan klave pa kubri.

SourceText: Step 3: Complete Parent Profiles
text: Etapa 3: Kompletá e profilnan di mayor

SourceText:
During or after each consultation, open your parent group in the app. 

1️⃣ Tap _Add Caregiver_
2️⃣ Fill in the Caregiver Profile 
3️⃣ Save the profile 
4️⃣ Repeat for each caregiver in the group

This profile captures important background information about the parent, child, and family situation.
text:
Durante òf despues di kada konsulta, habri bo grupo di mayor den e aplikashon. 

1️⃣ Primi _Agregá Kuido_
2️⃣ Yena e Profil di Kuido 
3️⃣ Warda e profil 
4️⃣Ripití pa kada dunadó di kuido den e grupo

E profil akí ta kapta informashon importante di antesedente tokante e mayor, e yu i e situashon di famia.

SourceText: Step 4: Create the WhatsApp Group
text: Etapa 4: Krea e Grupo di WhatsApp

SourceText:
Save parents’ names and WhatsApp numbers (if available) on your phone

Create your WhatsApp group with a temporary name, icon, and description.
text:
Warda nòmber i number di WhatsApp di mayornan (si ta disponibel) riba bo telefòn

Krea bo grupo di WhatsApp ku un nòmber, símbolo i deskripshon temporal.

SourceText: Use collaborative approach to learning
text: Usa aserkamentu di kolaborashon pa siña

SourceText:
In many other programmes, facilitators tell participants what to do and why it is important.

In @global.prog_name, we do things differently. We like to think of this as a collaborative and participatory approach to learning. As facilitators, you are collaborators or partners working with mothers, fathers, and caregivers to identify plans and practice solutions that will help them improve their lives at home.

It is helpful to think of mothers, fathers, and caregivers as experts who know their own children and circumstances. Many mothers, fathers, and caregivers will already be practising many positive ways of parenting their children. Others will be able to identify ways of improving their parenting on their own with guidance.

Our job is to support mothers, fathers, and caregivers learn for themselves how to achieve their goals. This sometimes means we have to work harder to ask the right sort of open-ended questions that will help mothers, fathers, and caregivers work out the benefits of positive parenting and nonviolent discipline for their children.

When mothers, fathers, and caregivers teach themselves, they learn a skill that will help them for a long time after the programme ends.
text:
Den hopi otro programa, fasilitadónan ta bisa partisipantenan kiko pa hasi i dikon e ta importante.

Den @global.prog_name, nos ta hasi kosnan diferente. Nos ta mira esaki komo un aserkamentu di kolaborashon i partisipashon pa siña. Komo fasilitadó, boso ta kolaboradó òf partner ku ta traha ku mamanan, tatanan i dunadónan di kuido pa identifiká plannan i praktiká solushonnan ku lo yuda nan mehorá nan bida na kas.

Ta bon pa pensa riba mamanan, tatanan i dunadónan di kuido komo ekspertonan ku konosé nan mes yunan i sirkunstansianan. Hopi mama, tata i dunadó di kuido lo ta praktikando hopi manera positivo di edukashon familiar ku nan yunan kaba. Otronan lo por identifiká maneranan di mehorá nan edukashon familiar riba nan mes ku guia.

Nos trabou ta pa sostené mamanan, tatanan i dunadónan di kuido pa siña pa nan mes kon pa logra nan metanan. Tin bia esaki ta nifiká ku nos mester traha mas duru pa hasi e tipo di preguntanan habrí korekto ku lo yuda mamanan, tatanan i dunadónan di kuido traha riba e benefisionan di edukashon familiar positivo i disiplina no violento pa nan yunan.

Ora mamanan, tatanan i dunadónan di kuido siña nan mes, nan ta siña un abilidat ku lo yuda nan pa hopi tempu despues ku e programa terminá.
note: The string @global.prog_name, should not be translated.

SourceText: Model the behaviour you want to see
text: Duna ehèmpel di e komportashon ku bo ke mira

SourceText:
The modelling principle forms the foundation of how we deliver @global.prog_name.

If we lead sessions in a collaborative approach, praise mothers, fathers, and caregivers often, practise active listening, and use positive instructions, mothers, fathers, and caregivers will do the same with their children.

Likewise, if we tell mothers, fathers, and caregivers what to do, criticise or laugh at them, ignore their needs or concerns, or only say what we do not want them to do, they will do the same.

Practise relaxation activities to help reduce your own stress. It can even just be taking a deep breath. Mothers, fathers, and caregivers will learn from your example and begin to mirror your behaviour.

In many ways, you are parenting the mothers, fathers, and caregivers in the way that you would like them to parent their children. It really works!
text:
E prinsipio di duna ehèmpel ta forma e fundeshi di kon nos ta implementá @global.prog_name.

Si nos guia seshonnan den un aserkamentu di kolaborashon, elogiá mamanan, tatanan i dunadónan di kuido ku frekuensia, praktiká skuchamentu aktivo i usa instrukshonnan positivo, mamanan, tatanan i dunadónan di kuido lo hasi meskos ku nan yunan.

Asina tambe, si nos bisa mamanan, tatanan i dunadónan di kuido kiko pa hasi, kritiká òf hari nan, ignorá nan nesesidatnan òf preokupashonnan, òf solamente bisa loke nos no ke pa nan hasi, nan lo hasi meskos.

Praktiká aktividatnan di relahashon pa yuda redusí bo propio strès. E por asta ta djis hala un rosea profundo. Mamanan, tatanan i dunadónan di kuido lo siña for di bo ehèmpel i kuminsá reflehá bo komportashon.

Na hopi manera, bo ta edukando e mamanan, tatanan i dunadónan di kuido di e manera ku bo lo ke pa nan eduká nan yunan. E ta funshoná di bèrdat!
note: The string @global.prog_name. should not be translated.

SourceText: Go at the pace of the group
text: Bai segun e ritmo di e grupo

SourceText:
You should always go at your mothers, fathers, and caregivers’ pace when delivering the programme. Make sure that the mothers, fathers, and caregivers in your group have understood the current content before moving on to new content.

This may mean that you take extra time problem-solve issues that come up during the sessions.
text:
Semper bo mester bai segun e ritmo di e mama, tata i dunadónan di kuido ora di implementá e programa. Sòru pa e mamanan, tatanan i dunadónan di kuido den bo grupo a komprondé e kontenido aktual promé ku pasa pa kontenido nobo.

Esaki por nifiká ku bo ta tuma tempu èkstra pa solushoná problema ku ta surgi durante e seshonnan.

SourceText: Make @global.prog_name a happy and safe space to learn
text: Hasi @global.prog_name un espasio dushi i sigur pa siña
note: The string @global.prog_name should not be translated.

SourceText:
Everyone likes a place that is warm and inviting. Tips for facilitators to make @global.prog_name a happy place to learn:

1️⃣ Invite mothers, fathers, and caregivers to participate: Notice when someone is holding back and ask if he or she wishes to share an opinion or experience.

2️⃣ Mention that this is a safe and empathetic space where no one will be judged. Experiences shared within the group will be kept confidential.

3️⃣ Make sure that everyone in the room can hear you (and each other).

4️⃣ Sit when you are talking. Be on the same level as the mothers, fathers, and caregivers and sit among them. If possible, try to sit among the mothers, fathers, and caregivers instead of at the front of the group.

5️⃣ Create a comfortable and welcoming place to meet.

6️⃣ Make sure there are enough chairs and that the room is clean. In the summer, use a fan or an air conditioner (if available). You can even decorate the room if you want!

7️⃣ Establish the language needs of the participants.

8️⃣ Respect whatever a parent shares with the group.

9️⃣ There will be lots of laughter in the group but try to laugh with not at a parent even if what they say sounds ridiculous. 

🔟Praise mothers, fathers, and caregivers for their effort and dedication.

1️⃣1️⃣ Model the behaviour you want from the mothers, fathers, and caregivers in the way that you treat them.

1️⃣2️⃣ Praise, respect, and reflect on mothers, fathers, and caregivers’ contributions.
text:
Tur hende ta gusta un lugá ku ta kaluroso i kaminda bo ta sinti bo bon biní. Tepnan pa fasilitadónan pa hasi @global.prog_name un lugá dushi pa siña:

1️⃣ Invitá mamanan, tatanan i dunadónan di kuido pa partisipá: Tuma nota ora un hende wanta su mes atras i puntra si e ta deseá di kompartí un opinion òf eksperensia.

2️⃣ Menshoná ku esaki ta un espasio seif i ku empatia kaminda lo no husga niun hende. Eksperensianan kompartí den e grupo lo keda konfidensial.

3️⃣ Sòru pa tur hende den e kamber por tende bo (i tende otro).

4️⃣ Sinta ora bo ta papiando. Ta na e mesun nivel ku e mamanan, tatanan i dunadónan di kuido i sinta meimei di nan. Si ta posibel, purba di sinta meimei di e mamanan, tatanan i dunadónan di kuido en bes di sinta dilanti di e grupo.

5️⃣ Krea un lugá kómodo i ku ta hasi hende sinti nan mes bon biní pa topa.

6️⃣ Sòru pa tin sufisiente stul i ku e kamber ta limpi. Den temporada di hopi kalor, usa un fèn òf un èrko (si esakinan ta disponibel). Bo por asta dekorá e kamber si bo ke!

7️⃣ Establesé e nesesidatnan di idioma di e partisipantenan.

8️⃣ Respetá loke ku un mayor ta kompartí ku e grupo.

9️⃣ Lo tin hopi harimentu den e grupo pero purba hari ku e mayor i no hari e mayor ounke loke nan ta bisa ta zona ridíkulo.

🔟 Elogiá mamanan, tatanan i dunadónan di kuido pa nan esfuerso i dedikashon.

1️⃣1️⃣ Duna ehèmpel di e komportashon ku bo ke di e mamanan, tatanan i dunadónan di kuido dor di e manera ku bo ta trata nan.

1️⃣2️⃣ Elogiá, respetá i reflehá riba e kontribushonnan di mamanan, tatanan i dunadónan di kuido.
note: The string @global.prog_name should not be translated.

SourceText: 🗓️ Day 4 (e.g., Monday) — Home Practice Reminder
text: 🗓️ Dia 4 (p.e., Djaluna) — Rekordatorio di Práktika na Kas

SourceText: Encourage parents to practice their parenting tips at home by reminding them that the key to changing behaviours and attitudes is to practice them in their own lives.
text: Enkurashá mayornan pa praktiká nan tepnan di edukashon familiar na kas dor di kòrda nan ku e yabi pa kambia komportashon i aktitut ta pa praktiká nan den nan mes bida.

SourceText: 🗓️ Day 5 (e.g., Wednesday) — Chat Coming Soon
text: 🗓️ Dia 5 (p.e., Djarason) — 'Chat' Ta Bin Pronto

SourceText:
Remind parents about the session one day before the session takes place. Include any details they may need to attend the session, including time, date, group chat name and how to join the chat.

Give them an idea of what to expect by letting them know what topic you will be discussing in the coming week.

Make sure your message is positive and welcoming and that parents know you are looking forward to hearing from everyone!
text:
Kòrda mayornan tokante e seshon un dia promé ku e seshon tuma lugá. Inkluí kualke detaye ku nan lo mester pa asistí na e seshon, inkluyendo ora, fecha, nòmber di e kòmbersashon di grupo i kon pa djòin e kòmbersashon.

Duna nan un idea di kiko por spera dor di laga nan sa ki tópiko lo bo ta papiando di dje den e siman benidero.

Sòru pa bo mensahe ta positivo i kaluroso i ku mayornan sa ku bo ta ansioso pa tende di tur hende!

SourceText: What to cover in the WhatsApp Call?
text: Kiko pa kubri den e Yamada di WhatsApp?

SourceText:
Thank the parent for volunteering to lead the WhatsApp group.  

While engaging with other parents in the group, keep the following in mind:
🔵 Greet parents when engaging with them.
🔵 Respect what participants share and be aware of different ages, genders, values and circumstances.
🔵 Encourage parents to share and respond to each other - and praise them for it.
🔵 Remind parents of ground rules when needed.
🔵 Model the behaviour you want to see among the parents.

If the parent needs any prompts for discussion, share the following:
text:
Gradisí e mayor pa boluntario pa dirigí e grupo di WhatsApp.  

Miéntras bo ta atendé ku otro mayornan den e grupo, tene lo siguiente na mente:
🔵 Saludá mayornan ora bo ta atendé ku nan.
🔵 Respetá loke e partisipantenan ta kompartí i ta konsiente di diferente edat, sekso, balor i sirkunstansia.
🔵 Enkurashá mayornan pa kompartí i kontestá otro - i elogia nan pa esaki.
🔵 Kòrda mayornan riba e reglanan básiko ora ta nesesario.
🔵Duna ehèmpel di e komportashon ku bo ke mira bou di e mayornan.

Si e mayor mester di kualke instrukshon pa diskushon, kompartí lo siguiente:

SourceText: Some more building blocks for one-on-one time
text: Algun komponente básiko mas pa Tempu pa Abo ku Bo Yu

SourceText:
- Use words to describe what your child is doing during One-on-One Time – it shows you are paying attention to them and helps build vocabulary for younger children,

- Allow your child to take the lead during One-on-One time.

- Allow your child to invite you into their world by showing interest in what they are doing.

- Accept and observe instead of asking questions and criticising your child when playing.

- Play at your child’s developmental level and pace.

- Find ways of playing together instead of competitive games during One-on-One time.
text:
- Usa palabranan pa deskribí kiko bo yu ta hasiendo durante Tempu pa Abo ku Bo Yu – e ta mustra ku bo ta paga tinu na nan i ta yuda konstruí vokabulario pa muchanan mas yòn,

- Permití bo yu tuma e liderazgo durante Tempu pa Abo ku Bo Yu.

- Permití bo yu invitá bo den su mundu dor di mustra interes den loke e ta hasiendo.

- Aseptá i opservá en bes di hasi pregunta i kritiká bo yu ora di hunga.

- Hunga na e nivel i segun e ritmo di desaroyo di bo yu.

- Buska maneranan di hunga huntu en bes di weganan kompetitivo durante Tempu pa Abo ku Bo Yu.

SourceText: More One-on-One time building blocks for parents with adolescents
text: Mas komponentenan básiko di Tempu pa Abo ku Bo Yu pa mayornan ku yunan adolesente

SourceText:
- One-on-One time means giving your full attention to your teen.

- Allow your teen to talk to lead in a conversation or activity.

- Look at your teen while they are speaking.

- Show interest in their story and acceptance of their feelings.
text:
- Tempu pa Abo ku Bo Yu ta nifiká duna bo atenshon kompletu na bo yu tiner.

- Pèrmití bo yu pa papia pa guia den un kombersashon òf aktividat.

- Wak bo tiner miéntras e ta papia.

- Mustra interes den e loke e ta konta i aseptashon di su sintimentunan.

SourceText: Key issues to be aware of
text: Asuntunan klave pa tene kuenta kuné

SourceText:
In this first module it’s important to create a welcoming space for everyone. 

Ground rules should be developed at the beginning of the programme and owned by the group – so everybody should agree. 
- Try to help parents make specific rules. 
- Make sure everybody in the group understands each rule and what is required of the group.
- Help parents to make positive rules! Instead of ‘no criticising’ try ‘provide supportive feedback’.
- Give parents a chance to debate the rules that are being suggested. This will help everyone to own the final set of rules. 
- Praise suggestions!

**Praise & confidence building**: Remember that just like speaking up in a group for the first time, parents might be feeling nervous. Give parents as much positive reinforcement and thanks for sharing as you can on day one. 

**Normalising difficult households**: Make sure you remind parents that no household is perfect! We all have problems and challenges – praise parents regularly for being here because they want to put in the work to change something for the better. 

**Confidentiality:** This means that what gets said or circulated in the group, stays in the group! It’s important to be clear right at the beginning what is okay to share with others outside the group and what is not. In order for people to feel comfortable enough to participate, they need to know that they can trust the group with the stories they are sharing – and that these will not be shared outside of the group. Sharing new positive information is absolutely fine, though! 

If there is a need to break confidentiality, it is because a parent has disclosed or has shown evidence or significant risk of harm to themselves or their children (physical, emotional, or physical). The facilitator needs to break confidentiality if there is a risk of self-harm or harm to others. When this happens, the facilitator will ensure that they communicate directly in private with the person in question.
text:
Den e promé módulo akí ta importante pa krea un espasio kaluroso pa tur hende. 

Mester desaroyá reglanan básiko na kuminsamentu di e programa i esakinan ta propiedat di e grupo – pues tur hende mester ta di akuerdo. 
- Purba yuda mayornan traha reglanan spesífiko. 
- Sòru pa tur hende den e grupo komprondé kada regla i kiko ta rekerí di e grupo.
- Yuda mayornan traha reglanan positivo! En bes di ‘no kritiká’ purba ‘duna kontesta di sosten’.
- Duna mayornan chèns pa debatí riba e reglanan ku a sugerí. Esaki lo yuda tur hende pa ta doño di e sèt final di reglanan. 
- Elogiá sugerensianan!

**Elogio & krea konfiansa**: Kòrda ku meskos ku papia den un grupo pa promé biaha, mayornan por ta sinti nan mes nervioso. Duna mayornan mas tantu afirmashon positivo posibel i yama danki pa kompartí mas tantu ku bo por riba e promé dia. 

**Normalisá hogarnan difísil**: Sòru pa bo kòrda mayornan ku ningun kas ta perfekto! Nos tur tin problema i retonan – elogiá mayornan regularmente pa ta akí pasó nan ke duna di nan parti pa kambia algu pa mihó. 

**Konfidensialidat:** Esaki ta nifiká ku loke ta wòrdu bisá òf loke ta sirkulá den e grupo, ta keda den e grupo! Ta importante pa ta kla for di kuminsamentu kiko ta bon pa kompartí ku otronan pafó di e grupo i kiko nò. Pa hende por sinti nan mes sufisiente kómodo pa partisipá, nan mester sa ku nan por konfia e grupo ku e historianan ku nan ta kompartí – i ku esakinan lo no wòrdu kompartí pafó di e grupo. Kompartí informashon positivo nobo sí ta hopi bon! 

Si tin mester kibra konfidensialidat, ta pasobra un mayor a divulgá òf a mustra evidensia òf riesgo signifikante di daño na su mes òf su yunan (físiko, emoshonal òf físiko). E fasilitadó mester kibra konfidensialidat si tin riesgo di daño propio òf daño na otronan. Ora esaki sosodé, e fasilitadó lo sòru pa e komuniká direktamente den privá ku e persona en kuestion.

SourceText: Talking about emotions can be new
text: Papia tokante emoshon por ta nobo

SourceText: It is completely normal for parents to have difficulty talking about and expressing emotions and feelings. Parents may be trying to recognise their own emotions and communicate about them for the first time here. Talking about feelings also has the benefit of bringing awareness to positive emotions such as happiness or calmness!
text: Ta kompletamente normal pa mayornan tin difikultat pa papia tokante i ekspresá emoshon i sintimentunan. Mayornan por ta purbando di rekonosé nan mes emoshonnan i komuniká tokante nan pa promé biaha akí. Papia tokante sintimentunan tambe tin e benefisio di trese konsientisashon di emoshonnan positivo manera felisidat òf trankilidat!

SourceText: Emotions and gender
text: Emoshonnan i género

SourceText: Many people are taught not to cry when they are sad. This might be especially true for boys and men. It’s important to understand that boys and men have the same feelings as girls and women, and that sharing emotions does not need to reduce their sense of masculinity. Sharing emotions is a sign of courage and strength.
text: Hopi hende ta siña pa no yora ora nan ta tristu. Esaki por ta spesialmente bèrdat pa mucha hòmber i hende hòmber. Ta importante pa komprondé ku mucha hòmber i hende hòmber tin e mesun sintimentunan ku mucha muhé i hende muhé, i ku kompartí emoshonnan no mester redusí nan sentido di maskulinidat. Kompartí emoshon ta un señal di kurashi i forsa.

SourceText: Accepting negative emotions
text: Aseptá emoshonnan negativo

SourceText: Negative emotions are just as normal as positive emotions! Some parents might feel disrespected when their children display negative emotions. This does not mean that parents are losing control or authority over their child. Parents should encourage children to be aware of their emotions by helping them to name emotions, and to talk about how they are experiencing their emotions as this will help them to regulate their emotions.
text: Emoshonnan negativo ta mesun normal ku emoshonnan positivo! Algun mayor por sinti ku nan yunan ta falta rèspèt ora nan yunan ta mustra emoshonnan negativo. Esaki no ta nifiká ku mayornan ta pèrdiendo kòntròl òf outoridat riba nan yu. Mayornan mester enkurashá yunan pa ta konsiente di nan emoshonnan dor di yuda nan nombra emoshonnan, i pa papia tokante kon nan ta eksperensiá nan emoshonnan ya ku esaki lo yuda nan regulá nan emoshonnan.

SourceText: Keep focus on positive instead of negative behaviour
text: Keda enfoká riba komportashon positivo en bes di riba esun negativo

SourceText: Parents usually only notice the times when children do not follow instructions and miss the times when they do. Parents need to know what behaviour they want to see from their children and start describing that when giving instructions.
text: Mayornan por lo general ta ripará solamente e momentunan ku e muchanan no ta sigui instrukshon i ta pèrdè e momentunan ku si nan ta hasié. Mayornan mester sa ki komportashon nan ke mira di nan yunan i kuminsá deskribí esei ora di duna instrukshon.

SourceText: Giving positive instructions can be challenging at first
text: Duna instrukshonnan positivo por ta un reto na promé instante

SourceText: Learning how to give positive instructions can be challenging for parents at first. They are used to giving instructions in a negative way. Your job as a facilitator is to model how to give positive instructions. In this way, parents are encouraged to give clear, positive instructions.
text: Siña kon pa duna instrukshon positivo por ta un reto pa mayornan na promé instante. Nan ta kustumá di duna instrukshon na un manera negativo. Bo trabou komo fasilitadó ta pa duna ehèmpel kon pa duna instrukshonnan positivo. Di e manera ei, mayornan ta ser animá pa duna instrukshonnan kla i positivo.

SourceText: Supporting children living with disabilities
text: Sostené muchanan ku ta biba ku desabilidat

SourceText: Parents should support their children to be able to follow instructions by thinking about how to break them down into smaller pieces while still allowing their children the space to work independently. This will help children feel more confident while still being supported. They should also allow time and space for children to work things out before interfering.
text: Mayornan mester sostené nan yunan pa por sigui instrukshonnan dor di pensa kon pa kibra e instrukshonnan den pida mas chikitu miéntras ku nan ta sigui duna nan yunan e espasio pa traha independientemente. Esaki lo yuda muchanan sinti mas sigur di nan mes miéntras ku nan ta haña sosten. Nan mester duna e muchanan tambe e tempu i espasio pa solushoná nan mes problemanan promé ku intervení.

SourceText: Praising can feel awkward at first
text: Elogiá por sinti straño na promé instante

SourceText: Many parents don’t have experience of praise or positive attention themselves. They can feel embarrassed or awkward about praising their children. But praising becomes easier with practice – and it is rewarded by the response that children provide to being praised.
text: Hopi mayor mes no tin eksperensia di elogio òf atenshon positivo. Nan por sinti berguensa òf sinti inkómodo pa elogiá nan yunan. Pero elogio ta bira mas fásil ku práktika – i e ta wòrdu rekompensá a base di e reakshon ku e muchanan ta duna ora nan haña elogio.

SourceText: Involving everyone in the household in rules and routines
text: Enbolbí tur hende den kas den regla i rutinanan

SourceText:
While it’s important to involve the entire household in making household rules and routines, this can be difficult in some families where decisions are not made together. 

You can explore how discussing different ideas for rules and routines with members of the family can have a positive impact on everyone’s well-being. Children will feel respected and listened to and teens are more likely to follow rules if they have been involved in creating them.
text:
Ounke ku ta importante pa enbolbí henter e kas den trahamentu di reglanan i rutinanan di kas, esaki por ta difísil den algun famia kaminda no ta tuma desishonnan huntu. 

Bo por eksplorá kon kombersá tokante diferente idea pa regla i rutina ku miembronan di famia por tin un impakto positivo riba bienestar di tur hende. E muchanan lo sinti nan mes respetá i skuchá i hóbennan tin mas chèns di sigui reglanan si nan tabata enbolbí den kreashon di esakinan.

SourceText: The importance of sleep and bedtime routines
text: E importansia di soño i rutina promé ku bai drumi

SourceText:
Bedtime is one of the most important routines that parents can establish for their children. Children need enough sleep to grow and be healthy. A routine is a good way to help ensure that they get enough sleep. 

It’s also important to stress that parents, too, need to get enough sleep. Sleep deprivation affects everyone’s behaviour! Bedtime routines last about 30 minutes and can involve washing, establishing a quiet and calm environment, singing, or reading to your child and then providing an affectionate goodnight. 

Bedtime routines can even be helpful for teens. Less screen time and more relaxing activities help a teen get a good night of sleep. The same is true for parents and you!

Some families may live in crowded or stressful environments, or have irregular routines because of shift work or money worries. But even small, predictable bedtime moments can help children feel safe and secure.
text:
Ora di drumi ta un di e rutinanan mas importante ku mayornan por establesé pa nan yunan. Muchanan mester di sufisiente soño pa krese i ta saludabel. Un rutina ta un bon manera pa yuda garantisá ku nan ta haña sufisiente soño. 

Tambe ta importante pa enfatisá ku mayornan tambe mester drumi sufisiente. Falta di soño ta afektá komportashon di tur hende! Rutinanan di drumi ta dura mas o ménos 30 minüt i por enserá bañamentu, establesé un ambiente ketu i trankil, kantamentu òf lesa pa bo yu i despues duna un bonochi kariñoso. 

Rutinanan promé ku drumi por asta ta útil pa hóbennan. Ménos tempu riba pantaya i mas aktividat relahante ta yuda un hóben haña un bon anochi di soño. Meskos ta konta pa mayornan i pa abo!

Algun famia por ta biba den ambientenan yen di hende òf ku ta kousa strès, òf tin rutinanan iregular pa motibu di trabou di warda òf preokupashonnan di plaka. Pero asta momentunan chikí i predisibel promé ku bai drumi por yuda muchanan sinti nan mes seif i sigur.

SourceText: Gender
text: Género

SourceText: In some families the rules for boys and girls are different. This is often because of expectations or traditional norms relating to the different roles that boys and girls can play. This is something that could be explored further to see if the different rules are really necessary or are limiting boys or girls. Parents may need support thinking about how this may affect their children.
text: Den algun famia e reglanan pa mucha hòmber i mucha muhé ta diferente. Hopi bia esaki ta pa motibu di ekspektativanan òf normanan tradishonal relashoná ku e diferente ròlnan ku mucha hòmber i mucha muhé por hunga. Esaki ta algu ku por eksplorá mas leu pa wak si e diferente reglanan realmente ta nesesario of ta limitando e mucha hòmber of e mucha muhé. Mayornan lo mester di sosten pa pensa riba kon esaki por afektá nan yunan.

SourceText: Try to avoid misbehaviour in the first place
text: Purba di evitá mal komportashon na promé lugá

SourceText: Parents should try to avoid misbehaviour in the first place. By redirecting a child’s attention away from a problem behaviour towards a positive behaviour, parents can avoid needing to discipline their child. Parents should use redirect before the negative behaviour gets worse by giving a clear and positive instruction towards another activity. In this way they ignore the misbehaviour
text: Mayornan mester purba di evitá mal komportashon na promé lugá. Dor di redirigí e atenshon di un mucha for di un komportashon problemátiko pa un komportashon positivo, mayornan por evitá ku nan mester disipliná nan yu. Mayornan mester usa redirekshon promé ku e komportashon negativo bira pió dor di duna un instrukshon kla i positivo pa ku un otro aktividat. Di e forma akí nan ta ignora e mal komportashon

SourceText: Consequences are not punishments
text: Konsekuensianan no ta straf

SourceText: It is more helpful for parents to think of consequences as opportunities to teach their children that their actions have an impact both on themselves and on others. This, in turn, helps children to learn about responsibility and decision-making.
text: Ta mas útil pa mayornan pensa riba konsekuensianan komo oportunidatnan pa siña nan yunan ku nan akshonnan tin un impakto tantu riba nan mes komo riba otronan. Esaki, na su turno, ta yuda muchanan siña tokante responsabilidat i tumamentu di desishon.

SourceText: Remember: There are no ‘bad’ children…
text: Kòrda: No tin mucha 'mala muchal'…

SourceText: … Just ‘bad’ behaviours! Parents should try to keep their focus on their children’s behaviour. This will help them to remember that children need as much love and nurturing as they can provide.
text: … Djis 'mal' komportashon! Mayornan mester purba di tene nan enfoke riba e komportashon di nan yunan. Esaki lo yuda nan kòrda ku muchanan mester di mas tantu amor i kuido ku nan por proveé.

SourceText: Last module blues
text: E laf di e último módulo

SourceText: The last module of the programme can be emotionally challenging for parents, who may have developed relationships with each other. Many parents will also have come to depend on the support that they get from each other – especially for those who have a lot of challenges at home. It’s important to stress to parents that they can continue to support each other after the programme ends, and with someone taking over the administration of the chat, they can continue to go to the same space and meet the same people for that support.
text: E último módulo di e programa por ta emoshonalmente un reto pa mayornan, ku por a desaroyá relashonnan ku otro. Hopi mayor tambe lo a bin ta dependé di e sosten ku nan ta haña di otro – spesialmente pa esnan ku tin hopi reto na kas. Ta importante pa enfatisá serka mayornan ku nan por sigui sostené otro despues ku e programa kaba i ku si un hende tuma riba su mes e atministrashon di e kòmbersashon, nan por sigui bai na e mesun espasio i topa e mesun hendenan pa e sosten ei.

SourceText: Prepare for certificates
text: Prepará pa sertifikado

SourceText:
1️⃣ ** Review reports**: Take a quick look at your group’s reports and make sure you have filled the attendance accurately. This helps make sure no parent misses out. 

2️⃣ ** Reach out to your supervisor**: Let your supervisor know the program has finished and that parents in your group are ready for certificates. This gives them a heads-up to prepare the files for you.

3️⃣ ** Receive certificates from your supervisor**: Your supervisor will generate the certificates for all eligible parents. Coordinate with your supervisors to receive the copies of the certificates.

For an in-person closing session, you can print the certificates. 

For an online closing session, you can send the certificates as image via WhatsApp.
text:
1️⃣ ** Repasá rapòrtnan**: Tira un bista rápido riba e rapòrtnan di bo grupo i sòru pa bo a yena e asistensia korektamente. Esaki ta yuda sigurá ku ningun mayor no ta kai afó. 

2️⃣ ** Tuma kontakto ku bo supervisor**: Laga bo supervisor sa ku e programa a kaba i ku mayornan den bo grupo ta kla pa sertifikado. Esaki ta dun'e un chèns pa prepará e failnan pa bo.

3️⃣ ** Risibí sertifikado di bo supervisor**: Bo supervisor lo generá e sertifikadonan pa tur mayor ku ta bini na remarke. Kordiná ku bo supervisornan pa risibí e kopianan di e sertifikadonan.

Pa un seshon di klousura en persona, bo por imprimí e sertifikadonan. 

Pa un seshon di klousura ònlain, bo por manda e sertifikadonan komo imágen via WhatsApp.

SourceText:
Welcome to the @global.prog_name programme!

Thank you for your commitment and dedication to supporting children and families in your community.

@global.prog_name is a group-based family strengthening programme for families with children and teens ages 2 to 17. 
It has been designed specifically with the goal of promoting positive parent-child relationships to reduce the risk of physical and emotional child abuse and neglect in the communities.
text:
Bon Bini na e programa @global.prog_name!

Danki pa bo kompromiso i dedikashon pa sostené muchanan i famianan den bo komunidat.

@global.prog_name ta un programa di fortalesimentu di famia basá riba grupo pa famianan ku yu i hóbennan di edat 2 pa 17. 
A diseña esaki spesífikamente ku e meta di promové relashonnan positivo entre mayor i yu pa redusí e riesgo di abusu i negligensia físiko i emoshonal di mucha den e komunidatnan.

SourceText:
The @global.app_name is your digital companion for delivering the @global.prog_name programme with confidence. 

It is designed to support you as a facilitator, offering practical tools, guidance, and ready-to-use resources so you can focus on what matters most - building positive connections with parents.
**With this app, you can**:
- 📘Access step-by-step instructions for delivering each module.
- 💬Find guidance on introducing caregivers to the programme and providing ongoing support.
- 📂Explore detailed content, structure, and delivery plans for the programme.
- ▶️Use practical tools such as pre-drafted messages, audios, and videos to share with parent groups.
- 👥Manage parent groups with ease -  add and update parent information, track attendance, and generate reports.
text:
E @global.app_name ta bo kompañero digital pa fasilitá e programa @global.prog_name ku konfiansa.

E ta diseñá pa sostené bo komo fasilitadó, ofresiendo hèrmèntnan práktiko, guia i rekursonan kla pa usa pa bo por enfoká riba loke ta mas importante - krea konekshonnan positivo ku mayornan.
**Ku e aplikashon akí, bo por**:
- 📘Haña akseso na instrukshonnan paso pa paso pa por fasilitá kada módulo.
- 💬Haña guia pa introdusí dunadónan di kuido na e programa i duna sosten kontinuo.
- 📂Eksplorá kontenido detayá, struktura i plannan di fasilitashon pa e programa.
- ▶️Usa hèrmèntnan práktiko manera mensahenan, oudio i vidionan trahá di antemano pa kompartí ku gruponan di mayor.
- 👥Manehá gruponan di mayor ku fasilidat - agregá i aktualisá informashon di mayor, sigui asistensia i generá rapòrtnan.

SourceText:
The app is a guide to support you after your facilitator training. Remember, HOW you facilitate matters most. Delivering the content is only about 20% of the programme’s success. The other 80% depends on HOW you facilitate—your attitude, your empathy, and how you connect with and support parents throughout their journey.
Remember that if there is anything that you cannot remember or feel unsure of, practice it with another facilitator or ask your supervisor/coach. 

Just as we say to the parents, “It is what you do at home that makes the difference,” the same thing applies to you. 

When you practice facilitation skills before a module, you will be more confident and able to deliver the programme for parents.

It is also important that you practice the skills from the programme with your own children and teens at home (if you have any). You may also find that many of the skills are applicable and helpful in creating positive relationships with others, such as your colleagues, friends, and loved ones!  

Thank you for your commitment and dedication to reducing violence against children and promoting child wellbeing through positive parenting. You are a shining star for happy families!
text:
E aplikashon ta un guia pa sostené bo despues di bo entrenamentu di fasilitadó. Kòrda, ku e manera KON bo ta fasilitá ta mas importante. Kompartí kontenido ta solamente mas o ménos 20% di e éksito di e programa. E otro 80% ta dependé di KON bo ta fasilitá—bo aktitut, bo empatia i kon bo ta konektá ku i sostené mayornan durante henter nan trayekto.
Kòrda ku si tin algu ku bo no por kòrda òf bo ta sinti bo insigur di dje, praktik’é ku un otro fasilitadó òf puntra bo supervisor/'coach'.

Meskos ku nos ta bisa e mayornan, “Ta loke bo ta hasi na kas ta hasi e diferensia,” e mesun kos ta konta pa abo.

Ora bo praktiká abilidatnan di fasilitashon promé ku un módulo, lo bo ta mas sigur i kapas pa fasilitá e programa pa mayornan.

Tambe ta importante pa bo praktiká e abilidatnan di e programa ku bo mes yunan i hóbennan na kas (si bo tin esakinan). Bo por haña tambe ku hopi di e abilidatnan ta aplikabel i útil pa krea relashonnan positivo ku otronan, manera bo koleganan, amigunan i sernan kerí!

Danki pa bo kompromiso i dedikashon pa redusí violensia kontra mucha i promové bienestar di mucha pa medio di edukashon familiar positivo. Bo ta un strea briante pa famianan felis!

Ministerio di Desaroyo Sosial, Labor, i Bienestar, UNICEF Hulanda, Parenting for Lifelong Health, den kolaborashon ku Parenting Commission na Curaçao a desaroyá @global.prog_name.

Basá riba e programa original di Jenny Doubt, Jamie M. Lachman, Sussie Mjwara, Marija Raleva i Jennel Reyes, ku Yuanling Chen i Stephanie Eagling-Peche, lisensiá bou di CC BY-SA 4.0.

Adaptá pa Judiska Cijntje, Peggy Grootens, Yanieck Abdoelrahman - de Wolff, Ytske van Winden, Deepali Barapatre, Jenny Doubt, i Jamie M. Lachman bou di e mesun lisensia.

@global.prog_name ta parti di un inisiativa mas grandi yamá Parenting for Lifelong Health (PLH).

SourceText:
The overall goal of @global.prog_name is to provide parents with the skills to promote healthy child development, learning, and wellbeing. We achieve this goal by improving the following: 

- **Parent sense of responsibility and commitment**: Recognise and embrace their essential role in raising children.

- **Parenting knowledge, skill, and sense of competence**: Gaining practical skills and confidence in parenting

- **Parent knowledge in child development**: Understanding key stages of child development and age-appropriate needs.

- **Positive parenting behaviour**: Encouraging nurturing, respectful, and supportive interactions.

- **Positive, consistent discipline strategies**: Using calm, constructive, and consistent discipline.

- **Parental supervision of children**: Ensuring safe, attentive, and appropriate supervision.

- **Child behaviour and wellbeing**: Promoting healthy emotional and social development.

- **Caregiver mental health and social support**: Enhancing wellbeing through community support and self-care.
text:
E meta general di @global.prog_name ta pa proveé mayornan ku e abilidatnan pa promové desaroyo, siñamentu i bienestar saludabel di mucha. Nos ta logra e meta akí dor di mehorá lo siguiente: 

- **Sentido di responsabilidat i kompromiso di mayor**: Rekonosé i brasa nan ròl esensial den edukashon di yu.

- **Konosementu di edukashon familiar, abilidat i sentido di ta kompetente **: Haña abilidatnan práktiko i konfiansa den edukashon familiar

- **Konosementu di mayor den desaroyo di mucha**: Komprondementu di fasenan klave di desaroyo di mucha i nesesidatnan apropiá pa edat.

- **Komportashon positivo di edukashon familiar**: Enkurashá interakshonnan di kuido, respetuoso i di sosten.

- **Strategianan di disiplina positivo i konsistente**: Usando disiplina trankil, konstruktivo i konsistente.

- **Supervishon di mayornan riba yunan**: Garantisá supervishon sigur, atento i apropiá.

- **Komportashon di mucha i bienestar **: Promové desaroyo emoshonal i sosial saludabel.

- **Salú mental i sosten sosial di e dunadó di kuido**: Mehorá bienestar pa medio di sosten di komunidat i kuido propio.
note: The string @global.prog_name should not be translated.

SourceText:
As a facilitator, your role is to guide small groups of caregivers (usually 12–15 people) through the programme.

The @global.prog_name is designed to be flexible so that you can deliver it in a way that best fits your parent group.
The programme is delivered mainly through a **WhatsApp group**. You will set up and manage the group, share the curriculum with caregivers, and lead group discussions.
When you create a parent group in the app, you will choose the age group focus: Caregivers of young children (2-9), Caregivers of teens (10-17), Caregivers of young children and teens (2-17)
The programme has **six sessions**. These can be a mix of in-person and remote (WhatsApp-based) sessions.
You and your organisation can decide which format is best for your group:
- **Onboarding only (Session 1 in person)**: Meet parents face-to-face to build trust, explain how the programme works, and practice the first skills together.

- **Closing only (Session 6 in person)**: Meet parents face-to-face at the end to reflect, celebrate progress, and encourage continued practice.
- **Both onboarding and closing (Sessions 1 & 6 in person)**: Start strong with group connection and finish with a meaningful celebration.
- **Fully remote (all sessions on WhatsApp)**: Run everything online if in-person meetings are not possible.
The core of the programme always happens in the WhatsApp group, whether or not you have in-person sessions.
text:
Komo fasilitadó, bo ròl ta pa guia gruponan chikí di dunadónan di kuido (normalmente 12–15 persona) durante di e programa.

E @global.prog_name ta diseñá pa ta fleksibel pa bo por dun'é na un manera ku ta kuadra mihó ku bo grupo di mayor.
Ta fasilitá e programa prinsipalmente pa medio di un **grupo di WhatsApp**. Lo bo inisiá i manehá e grupo, kompartí e kuríkulo ku e dunadónan di kuido, i dirigí diskushonnan di grupo.
Ora bo krea un grupo di mayor den e aplikashon, lo bo skohe e enfoke di e grupo di edat: Dunadónan di Kuido di mucha chikí (2-19), Dunadónan di Kuido di hóben (10-17), Dunadónan di Kuido di mucha chikí i hóben (2-17)
E programa tin **seis seshon**. Esakinan por ta un meskla di seshonnan en persona i riba distansia (basá riba WhatsApp).
Abo i bo organisashon por disidí kua formato ta mihó pa bo grupo:
- **Seshon di Introdukshon so (Seshon 1 en persona)**: Topa mayornan kara-kara pa krea konfiansa, splika kon e programa ta funshoná i praktiká e promé abilidatnan huntu.

- **Klousura so (Seshon 6 en persona)**: Topa mayornan kara-kara na final pa reflehá, selebrá progreso, i enkurashá práktika kontinuo.
- **Tantu introdukshon komo klousura (Seshonnan 1 & 6 den persona)**: Kuminsá fuerte ku konekshon di grupo i finalisá ku un selebrashon signifikante.
- **Kompletamente riba distansia (tur seshon riba WhatsApp)**: Hasi tur kos ònlain si reunionnan en persona no ta posibel.
E núkleo di e programa semper ta sosodé den e grupo di WhatsApp, sea bo tin seshonnan en persona òf nò.
note: The string @global.prog_name should not be translated.

SourceText:
**Remote Session Routine (WhatsApp-Based)**
Sessions 2–5 are always run online using a **weekly schedule**:
**Day One** - Learn with a Story: Share lesson content (short pre-recorded videos with parenting story, parenting tips, and a home activity for parents to try).
**Day Four** - Reminder to try: Send a reminder to parents to practice the home activity.
**Day Five** - Chat coming soon: Send a reminder about the group chat the next day.
**Day Six** - Let’s connect: Host a live group chat (about 1 hour). Each live chat has a similar flow: check-in and discussion on home activity challenges
This schedule helps parents know what to expect and makes it easier for them to participate.
text:
**Rutina di Seshon Riba Distansia (Basá riba WhatsApp)**
Semper ta ehekutá seshonnan 2–5 ònlain usando un **programa semanal**:
**Dia Un** - Siña ku un Historia: Kompartí kontenido di lès (vidionan kòrtiku pre-grabá ku historia di mayor, un tep di edukashon familiar di mayor, i un relato na kas pa mayornan purba).
**Dia Kuater** - Rekordatorio pa purba: Manda un rekordatorio pa mayornan pa praktiká e aktividat di kas.
**Dia Sinku** - 'Chat' ta bini pronto: Manda un rekordatorio tokante e 'chat' di grupo e siguiente dia.
**Dia Seis** - Ban konektá: Guia un kòmbersashon di grupo en bibu (mas o ménos 1 ora). Kada kòmbersashon en bibu tin un fluho similar: hasi un chèk i hiba diskushon riba retonan di aktividat na kas
E skema akí ta yuda mayornan pa sa kiko por spera i ta hasié mas fásil pa nan partisipá.

The core programme focuses on one module each week over six weeks. 
The core modules are presented in this order: 

Module 1 – Introduction and spending one-on-one time with your child

Module 2 – Talking about feelings

Module 3 – Keeping it Positive: Giving instructions & delivering praise

Module 4 – Keeping your child safe with household rules & routines

Module 5 – Positive discipline: Using redirect and consequences

Module 6 – Problem-solving with children & final reflection
text:
E programa sentral ta enfoká riba un módulo kada siman durante seis siman.
Ta presentá e módulonan sentral den e sekuensia akí:

Módulo 1 – Introdukshon i tempu pa abo ku bo yu

Módulo 2 – Papia riba emoshon

Módulo 3 – Keda positivo: Duna instrukshon & duna elogio 

Módulo 4 – Mantené bo yu seif ku reglanan di kas i rutinanan diario

Módulo 5 – Disiplina positivo: Usa método di rederigí i konsekuensianan 

Módulo 6 – Resolvé problema huntu ku mucha i reflekshon final

SourceText:
The key approach to @global.prog_name is that we draw on the shared wisdom and experience of our parents to help brainstorm and problem-solve the challenges we want to tackle at home. That means that we want everybody to pool their ideas so that we all develop and practice new skills. 

Parents are welcome to share in whatever way they are most comfortable: text or audio messages. 

The foundation for this programme is the idea that parents want to strengthen their relationships with their kids in order to build a healthy home. That’s why they are here! 

The programme encourages positive interactions between parents and kids by helping parents to develop skills around praising good behaviour, spending quality time, and talking about feelings. 

If parents are spending time reinforcing positive behaviours with praise, then parents will have to do less work managing problem behaviours. 

Other skills that the programme introduces to manage unwanted behaviours include ignoring and redirecting negative attention-seeking behaviours and introducing consequences. 

The notion that children are kept safe by establishing rules and routines, planning for any risks, and surrounding them with as much care as possible underscores the entire programme.

The programme uses online messaging platforms that are familiar to parents (e.g., WhatsApp, Viber, Telegram, Facebook Messenger, etc.). 

The main teaching method in this programme is to do activities together to enable learning through doing instead of learning through being told. This method helps participants to learn both during the sessions and at home. 

This is because we all remember and understand things much better when we have done them ourselves.
text:
E aserkamentu klave pa @global.prog_name ta ku nos ta usa e sabiduria i eksperensia kompartí di nos mayornan pa yuda pensa huntu i solushoná problema pa loke ta trata e retonan ku nos ke atendé na kas. Esei ta nifiká ku nos ke pa tur hende pone nan ideanan huntu pa nos tur desaroyá i praktiká abilidatnan nobo.

Mayornan ta bon biní pa kompartí na kualke manera ku nan ta mas kómodo: mensahenan di teksto òf oudio.

E fundeshi pa e programa akí ta e idea ku mayornan ke fortalesé nan relashonnan ku nan yunan pa asina konstruí un hogar salú. Ta p’esei nan ta akí!

E programa ta enkurashá interakshonnan positivo entre mayornan i muchanan dor di yuda mayornan desaroyá abilidatnan ku ta enserá elogiá bon komportashon, pasa tempu di kalidat i papia tokante sintimentunan.

Si mayornan ta dediká tempu na reforsá komportashonnan positivo ku elogio, e ora ei mayornan lo mester hasi ménos trabou pa manehá komportashonnan problemátiko.

Otro abilidatnan ku e programa ta introdusí pa manehá komportashonnan indeseá ta inkluí ignorá i redirigí komportashonnan negativo di buska atenshon i introdusí konsekuensianan.

E idea ku ta tene muchanan seif dor di establesé reglanan i rutinanan, plania pa kualke riesgo, i rondoná nan ku mas tantu kuido posibel ta sirbi komo un base pa henter e programa.

E programa ta usa plataformanan di mensahe ònlain ku ta konosí pa mayornan (p.e., WhatsApp, Viber, Telegram, Facebook Messenger, etc.).

E método prinsipal di enseñansa den e programa akí ta pa hasi aktividatnan huntu pa permití siñamentu dor di hasi en bes di siña dor di wòrdu bisá kiko pa hasi. E método akí ta yuda e partisipantenan siña tantu durante e seshonnan komo na kas.

Esaki ta pasobra nos tur ta kòrda i komprondé kosnan muchu mas mihó ora nos mes a hasi nan.

_Only if you are delivering in-person session for your parent group_

- Make sure all materials and venues are prepared in advance of the session.

- Greet caregivers when they arrive at the session.

- Create a safe, comfortable and empathetic space, make them feel welcome with a smile and eye contact.

- Understand the relationship between the parent and their children. Remember that each relationship will be different.

- Remember that every child develops at different speeds and stages. 

- Respect what participants share and be aware of different ages, genders, values, and circumstances. 

- Encourage caregivers to share and respond to each other - and praise them when they do it!

- Remind caregivers of group rules when needed.

- Notice when a parent is quiet or struggles with something and provides support. 

- Model the behaviour you want to see among the mothers, fathers, and caregivers. 

- Use energisers to keep live interactions engaging and fun.
text:
_Solamente si bo ta fasilitando seshon en persona pa bo grupo di mayor_

- Sòru pa tur material i lugá ta prepará promé ku e seshon.

- Saludá e dunadónan di kuido ora nan yega na e seshon.

- Krea un espasio seif, kómodo i empatiko, laga nan sinti nan mes bon biní ku un sonrisa i kontakto visual.

- Komprondé e relashon entre e mayor i su yunan. Kòrda ku kada relashon lo ta diferente.

- Kòrda ku kada mucha ta desaroyá na diferente ritmo i fase.

- Respetá loke e partisipantenan ta kompartí i ta konsiente di diferente edat, sekso, balornan i sirkunstansia.

- Enkurashá dunadónan di kuido pa kompartí i reakshoná riba otro su aporte - i elogiá nan ora nan hasié!

- Kòrda dunadónan di kuido riba reglanan di grupo ora ta nesesario.

- Ripará ora un mayor ta ketu òf ta lucha ku algu i brinda sosten.

- Duna ehèmpel di e komportashon ku bo ke mira bou di e mamanan, tatanan i dunadónan di kuido.

- Usa aktividatnan ku ta duna energia pa tene interakshonnan bibu atraktivo i dibertido.

SourceText:
It’s important to be **well prepared**. This shows respect for the parents and will help ensure that they get as much out of the module as they can. 

Each module begins with ways you can prepare to deliver a session.

Before the day begins:

1️⃣ Ensure you know what needs to take place. 

2️⃣ On Learn with a Story, Home Practice Reminder and Chat Coming Soon that means thinking through when you will send messages.

3️⃣ On Let’s Connect that means re-reading the module you will be giving, scrolling through messages that parents have sent about home practice (if any) and making sure that you are absolutely clear on what needs to take place. 

4️⃣ Go through any notes you have to personalise or direct message parents as necessary. This will also help you to remember what took place and prepare you for the next module.

5️⃣ Ensure that any technology that you need is prepared: Phones charged, videos, recordings and illustration files have been tested and are ready to upload, internet connection secure. Make a back-up plan for any tech failures – including alternative ways to communicate with parents and re-scheduling group sessions if needed.

6️⃣ If you’re creating audio or video files of yourself to upload, make sure that the audio or video message is as clear as possible – they don’t need to be professional, but they do need to communicate clearly! Make sure there’s enough light and that you are clearly visible, don’t change the direction of the video you are shooting (for video), avoid background sounds and speak clearly.
text:
Ta importante pa ta **bon prepará**. Esaki ta mustra rèspèt pa e mayornan i lo yuda nan pa saka mas tantu for di e módulo ku nan por.

Kada módulo ta kuminsá ku maneranan ku bo por prepará pa fasilitá un seshon.

Promé ku e dia kuminsá:

1️⃣ Sòru pa bo sa kiko mester tuma lugá.

2️⃣ Pa loke ta trata Siña ku un Historia, Rekordatorio di Práktika na Kas i 'Chat' Ta Bin Pronto esei ta nifiká pensa riba ki ora bo ta bai manda mensahenan.

3️⃣ Pa loke ta trata Let’s Connect esei ta nifiká bolbe lesa e módulo ku bo ta bai duna, pasa dor di mensahenan ku mayornan a manda tokante práktika na kas (si tin) i sòru pa bo ta kompletamente konsiente di kiko mester tuma lugá.

4️⃣ Pasa dor di kualke nota ku bo tin pa personalisá òf manda un mensahe direkto mayornan segun ta nesesario. Esaki lo yuda bo tambe pa kòrda kiko a tuma lugá i prepará bo pa e siguiente módulo.

5️⃣ Sòru pa kualke teknologia ku bo mester, ta prepará: Telefònnan kargá, tèst vidionan, grabashonnan i failnan di ilustrashon i nan ta kla pa subi, konekshon di internèt sigur. Traha un plan B pa kualke fayo di teknologia – inkluyendo maneranan alternativo pa komuniká ku mayornan i re-programá seshonnan di grupo si ta nesesario.

6️⃣ Si bo ta kreando failnan di oudio òf vidio di bo mes pa subi, sòru pa e mensahe di oudio òf vidio ta mas kla posibel – nan no mester ta profeshonal, pero nan mester trese e mensahe ku klaridat! Sòru pa tin sufisiente lus i ku bo ta bon visibel, no kambia e direkshon di e vidio ku bo ta grabando (ora ta trata vidio), evitá zonidonan di fondo i papia kla.

SourceText:
You’ll help parents learn one new parenting skill each week by sharing lesson content across the week.

📹 **What You’ll Share**

Each week, you’ll send videos with parenting tips. These tips are the main part of the module.

Most videos include two short stories:
👶 One for children aged 2–9
🧑‍🎓 One for teens aged 10–17

👉 If your group includes only young children or only teens, you’ll send one story video.
👉 If your group includes both, you’ll send both videos.


📖 **What’s in the videos?**

Each story uses illustrations to show real-life situations.
A short explainer at the end helps parents reflect and understand the parenting tips.

These stories make it easier for parents to relate to the skill and think about how to use it at home.


🏡 **Home Practice**

Each week, parents are encouraged to try the tips at home.

This is a key part of the programme!
It helps parents practice new skills in real life.

You can support them by helping them plan:
🕓 When to try the tip
📍 Where they can do it
📝 How they might do it with their child
text:
Lo bo yuda mayornan siña un abilidat nobo di edukashon familiar tur siman dor di kompartí kontenido di lès durante henter siman.

📹 **Kiko Bo Ta Kompartí**

Tur siman, bo ta manda vidionan ku tepnan di edukashon familiar. E tepnan akí ta e parti prinsipal di e módulo.

Mayoria di e vidionan ta inkluí dos historia kòrtiku:
👶 Un pa muchanan di 2–9 aña di edat.
🧑‍🎓 Un pa tinernan di 10–17 aña di edat 

👉 Si bo grupo ta inkluí solamente mucha chikí òf solamente tiner, bo ta manda un vidio di historia.
👉 Si bo grupo ta inkluí tur dos, bo ta manda tur dos vidio.


📖 **Kiko tin den e vidionan?**

Kada historia ta usa ilustrashonnan pa mustra situashonnan di bida real.
Un splikashon kòrtiku na final ta yuda mayornan reflehá i komprondé e tepnan di edukashon familiar.

E historianan akí ta hasié mas fásil pa mayornan relashoná ku e abilidat i pensa kon pa us’é na kas.


🏡 **Práktika na Kas**

Tur siman, ta enkurashá mayornan pa purba e tepnan na kas.

Esaki ta un parti klave di e programa!
E ta yuda mayornan praktiká abilidatnan nobo den bida real.

Bo por sostené nan dor di yuda nan plania:
🕓 Ki ora pa purba e tep
📍Unda nan por hasie
📝 Kon nan por hasié ku nan yu

SourceText:
Encourage parents to practice their parenting tips at home by reminding them that the key to changing behaviours and attitudes is to practice them in their own lives. 

You will send two reminders during the week:
text:
Enkurashá mayornan pa praktiká nan tepnan di edukashon familiar na kas dor di kòrda nan ku e yabi pa kambia komportashon i aktitut ta pa praktiká nan den nan mes bida.

Lo bo manda dos rekordatorio durante siman:

SourceText:
**Welcome and Check-in** 

Begin each session with a message that welcomes the parents to the session chat. 

Check-in to make sure that everyone is ready to begin the session. This is easier said than done when you are online! You may want to ask if that everybody’s connection is steady and that they are comfortable and sitting somewhere where they can ‘chat’. 

Praise parents for making the effort to join the session and let them know you are excited to get going!

Take responsibility for ensuring that everybody’s contribution is heard. This means making sure you understand the language needs and abilities of participants before you begin – will everybody be typing? Or will there be a mix of audio and text from parents?

Framing the session: It’s important to let parents know what to expect from each session. Start each session by letting them know what home activity are we discussing.

Ask parents how they are feeling today. You can model this process by sending a message that shares about how you are feeling today and describing where you are feeling it in your body, for example: “Today I am tired! I was up at night with my child. I can feel it in my sore, heavy feet, which don’t seem to want to walk anywhere very fast!”


**Checking in on home activity**
Start by reminding parents what last week’s parenting tip was. Ask a simple question to see who tried it — like a 👍 or “Yes/Not yet.” Keep it light and supportive. Praise parents who gave it a try, even if it was just a little. Encourage those who didn’t — remind them it’s okay to try again this week.

**Voting on a challenge to discuss** 
After checking in on the home activity, give parents a chance to vote on a common challenge they may have faced. Share 3–4 relatable options. This helps parents feel seen and makes it easy to respond.

Let them know it’s normal to face challenges — voting creates a safe space to talk about what was hard.
text:
**Bon Bini i Chèk na inisio**

Kuminsá kada seshon ku un mensahe ku ta yama e mayornan bon biní na e seshon di kòmbersashon.

Hasi un chèk na inisio pa ta sigur ku tur hende ta kla pa kuminsá e seshon. Esaki ta mas fásil pa bisa ku hasi ora bo ta ònlain! Bo por puntra si e konekshon di tur hende ta stabil i ku nan ta sinti nan mes kómodo i si nan ta sintá un kaminda kaminda nan por 'chat'.

Elogiá mayornan pa a hasi e esfuerso pa djòin e seshon i laga nan sa ku bo ta entusiasmá pa kuminsá!

Tuma responsabilidat pa perkurá pa tur hende su kontribushon wòrdu skuchá. Esaki ta nifiká sòru ku bo ta komprondé e nesesidatnan i abilidatnan di idioma di e partisipantenan promé ku bo kuminsá – tur hende lo taip? Òf lo tin un meskla di oudio i teksto di mayornan?

Formulá enfoke di e seshon: Ta importante pa laga mayornan sa kiko por spera di kada seshon. Kuminsá kada seshon dor di laga nan sa di ki tepnan di edukashon familiar lo bo papia awe i si nan por spera di mira ilustrashonnan, vidio... òf tur dos!

Puntra mayornan kon nan ta sinti awe. Bo por duna ehèmpel di e proseso akí dor di manda un mensahe tokante kon abo ta sintiendo awe i deskribí unda bo ta sintié den bo kurpa, por ehèmpel: “Awe mi ta kansá! Mi a keda lantá anochi ku mi yu. Mi por sintié den mi pianan due i pisá, ku no ta parse di ke kana muchu lihé bai niun kaminda!”


**Chèk riba aktividat na kas**
Kuminsá dor di kòrda mayornan kiko tabata e tep di edukashon familiar di siman pasá. Hasi un pregunta simpel pa wak ken a purba esaki — manera un 👍 òf “Si/Ainda nò.” Mantené esaki simpel i duna sosten. Elogiá mayornan ku a purba, asta si e tabata djis un tiki. Enkurashá esnan ku no a hasié — kòrda nan ku ta bon pa purba atrobe e siman akí.

**Vota riba un reto pa diskutí**
Despues di chèk riba e aktividat di kas, duna mayornan un chèns pa vota riba un reto komun ku porta nan a enfrentá. Kompartí 3–4 opshon ku nan por relashoná kuné. Esaki ta yuda mayornan sinti ku nan ta wòrdu mirá i ta hasié fásil pa reakshoná.

Laga nan sa ku ta normal pa enfrentá retonan — votashon ta krea un espasio seif pa papia tokante loke tabata difísil.

SourceText:
**Discussing Solution** 
Before arriving at a solution, it is useful to explore the challenge in depth.

_**Tips for exploring questions and challenges**_

Use open-ended questions! So instead of saying “did you do this tip?” ask “How did the tip work in your home?” 

Try using Who? What? When? Why? Where? And How?

Remember to redirect what the participant says to topics related to the programme.

Praise, praise, and praise some more! When you praise the parents, you demonstrate how praising works and help to promote the positive while parents are tackling challenges.

The stages of problem solving can be useful to develop a specific pool of possible solutions to the challenges that are being discussed. 

Brainstorm solutions: Start the process with a quick brainstorm for possible solutions. Invite all parents to contribute any ideas that they think will work. If they are struggling to contribute, ask them to share strategies that they have tried in their own homes. Make sure you take note of the solutions you would like to discuss further with the group.

Summarise the solutions that have been proposed.

Explore the consequences for the selected solutions: Explore solutions by inviting the group to think about the consequences of each proposed solution. This might include a child’s perspective or experience of each solution; and any feelings that it might evoke. Guide the discussion carefully so that parents have an opportunity to think through what might not work with any problematic suggestions.

Select a solution: Parents pick a solution that they want to try out at home.
→ Remember to praise: Praise parents for working through a challenge and encourage them to try their solution out at home. 


**Open Feedback** 
Invite parents to share their experience from home – ensuring that each parent that wants to share gets a chance to do so. Parents can share success stories as well as any challenges that came up while they were practicing at home. 

Connect the success to the building block for that parenting tip. This will help to remind and reinforce the building blocks for that parenting tip.

Invite the group to then discuss the challenge(s) that have been shared. Select one of the challenges shared by the parents. Follow the steps of “Discussing the solution.”

Remember that parents will often expect facilitators to have all of the answers – but parents are the experts in their own lives and have a lot of experience to draw from in sharing their own solutions. This will help circulate new ideas to the group.


**Take a Pause and Closing**

Take a Pause is an opportunity for parents to reconnect with their breathing and themselves. It’s a quiet moment at the end of the session that they can also use at home when they are feeling stressed.

Closing the session is an opportunity to pull out the most important content from the session. Most importantly, closing the session is an opportunity to tell parents what they are doing right! Thank parents for sharing and reminding them all how difficult it can be to try new things. Praise, praise, praise them for the work they are doing to make themselves and their families healthier and happier!
text:
**Diskutí Solushon**
Promé ku yega na un solushon, ta útil pa eksplorá e reto profundamente.

_**Tepnan pa eksplorá preguntanan i retonan**_

Usa preguntanan habrí! Pues en bes di bisa “bo a hasi e tep akí?” puntra “Kon e tep a funshoná den bo kas?”

Purba usa Ken? Kiko? Ki ora? Dikon? Na unda? I Kon?

Kòrda redirigí loke e partisipante ta bisa na tópikonan relashoná ku e programa.

Elogiá, elogiá, i elogiá un tiki mas! Ora bo ta elogiá e mayornan, bo ta demostrá kon elogio ta funshoná i ta yuda promové loke ta positivo miéntras mayornan ta atendé ku retonan.

E fasenan di solushoná problema por ta útil pa desaroyá un grupo spesífiko di posibel solushonnan pa e retonan ku ta diskutí.

Pensa solushonnan huntu: Kuminsá e proseso ku un 'brainstorm' rápido pa posibel solushonnan. Invitá tur mayor pa kontribuí ku kualke idea ku nan ta kere ku lo funshoná. Si nan tin difikultat pa kontribuí, pidi nan pa kompartí strategianan ku nan a purba den nan mes kas. Sòru pa bo tuma nota di e solushonnan riba kua ku bo ke papia mas aleu ku e grupo.

Resumí e solushonnan ku nan a proponé.

Eksplorá e konsekuensianan pa e solushonnan selektá: Eksplorá solushonnan dor di invitá e grupo pa pensa riba e konsekuensianan di kada solushon proponé. Esaki por inkluí e perspektiva òf eksperensia di un mucha pa ku kada solushon; i kualke sintimentu ku e por lanta. Guia e diskushon kuidadosamente pa asina mayornan tin un oportunidat pa pensa riba kiko kisas lo no funshoná ku e sugerensianan ku lo por trese problema.

Selektá un solushon: Mayornan ta skohe un solushon ku nan ke purba na kas.
→ Kòrda elogiá: Elogiá mayornan pa traha riba un reto i enkurashá nan pa purba nan solushon na kas.


**Komentario habrí**
Invitá mayornan pa kompartí nan eksperensia for di kas – sigurando ku kada mayor ku ke kompartí ta haña un chèns pa hasi esaki. Mayornan por kompartí historianan di éksito i tambe kualke reto ku a bini dilanti miéntras nan tabata praktiká na kas.

Konektá e éksito na e komponente básiko pa e tep di edukashon familiar ei. Esaki lo yuda pa kòrda i reforsá e komponentenan básiko pa e tep di edukashon familiar ei.

Invitá e grupo pa despues papia tokante e reto(nan) ku nan a kompartí. Selektá un di e retonan ku e mayornan a kompartí. Sigui e pasonan di “Diskutí e solushon.”

Kòrda ku mayornan hopi bia lo spera ku fasilitadónan tin tur e kontestanan – pero mayornan ta e ekspertonan den nan mes bida i tin hopi eksperensia pa saka for di dje pa kompartí nan mes solushonnan. Esaki lo yuda sirkulá ideanan nobo pa e grupo.


**Tuma un Pousa i Klousura**

Tuma un Pousa ta un oportunidat pa mayornan rekonektá ku nan halamentu di rosea i nan mes. E ta un momentu trankil na final di e seshon ku nan por usa tambe na kas ora nan ta sinti strès.

Klousura di e seshon ta un oportunidat pa saka e kontenido mas importante for di e seshon. Mas importante ainda, sera e seshon ta un oportunidat pa bisa mayornan kiko nan ta hasiendo korekto! Gradisí mayornan pa kompartí i rekordá nan tur kon difísil e por ta pa purba kosnan nobo. Elogiá, elogiá, elogiá nan pa e trabou ku nan ta hasendo pa hasi nan mes i nan famia mas saludabel i felis!

SourceText:
At the end of every Let’s Connect session, you will be asked to complete a short report in the app. This includes recording parent attendance, reflecting on how the session went, and noting any challenges you faced and what you might try differently next time.

These reports are not just about record-keeping—they are a chance for you to pause, reflect, and learn from your own experience. Each session brings something new, and taking a few minutes to capture your thoughts can help you build confidence, celebrate what went well, and identify small changes that can make the next session even smoother.

Based on the attendance you record, the Actions tab will highlight parents who have missed two sessions in a row. This makes it easier for you to notice families who might need some extra encouragement. By reaching out early, you can help them feel supported and keep them engaged in the programme.
text:
Na final di kada seshon di Let’s Connect, lo pidi bo pa kompletá un rapòrt kòrtiku den e aplikashon. Esaki ta inkluí anotá asistensia di mayornan, reflehá riba kon e seshon a bai i anotá kualke reto ku bo a enfrentá i kiko bo por purba diferente otro biaha.

E rapòrtnan akí no ta djis tokante mantenshon di registro—nan ta un chèns pa bo para ketu, reflehá i siña for di bo propio eksperensia. Kada seshon ta trese algu nobo, i tumando algun minüt pa kapta bo pensamentunan por yuda bo krea konfiansa, selebrá loke a bai bon, i identifiká kambionan chikí ku por hasi e siguiente seshon kana mas mihó ainda.

A base di e asistensia ku bo ta registrá, e página di Akshonnan lo pone énfasis riba mayornan ku a pèrdè dos seshon tras di otro. Esaki ta hasié mas fásil pa bo nota famianan ku kisas mester di algun enkurashamentu èkstra. Dor di yega trempan, bo por yuda nan sinti nan mes sostené i tene nan enbolbí den e programa.

SourceText:
This app will guide you on what to do each week. It describes the activities in detail. It provides possible questions that you can ask for discussions and parenting stories.
 
However, the content of the programme is only a small part of what it takes to deliver @global.prog_name. 
Much of the benefit that your parents will receive comes from the way that you deliver it. 

**There are 8 core Principles to facilitating @global.prog_name in the best possible way**:
text:
E aplikashon akí lo guia bo riba kiko pa hasi tur siman. E ta deskribí e aktividatnan den detaye. E ta proveé posibel preguntanan ku bo por hasi pa diskushonnan i historianan di edukashon familiar.
 
Sinembargo, e kontenido di e programa ta solamente un parti chikí di loke ta nesesario pa fasilitá @global.prog_name. 
Hopi di e benefisio ku bo mayornan lo risibí ta bini di e manera ku bo ta fasilitá esaki. 

**Tin 8 Prinsipio sentral pa fasilitá @global.prog_name na e mihó manera posibel**:

SourceText:
1️⃣ Use a collaborative approach to learning.

2️⃣ Model the behaviour you want to see in the way that you behave towards participants.

3️⃣ Practice A-E-C-P: Accept, Explore, Connect, and Practice. 

4️⃣ Be aware of child developmental stages. 
 
5️⃣ Go at your participants’ pace.

6️⃣ Come prepared for each session. 

7️⃣ Make @global.prog_name a happy place to learn.

8️⃣ Don’t be afraid to have fun!
text:
1️⃣ Usa un aserkamentu kolaborativo pa siña.

2️⃣ Duna ehèmpel di e komportashon ku bo ke mira den e manera ku bo ta komportá bo mes pa ku partisipantenan.

3️⃣ Praktiká A-E-K-P: Aseptá, Eksplorá, Konektá i Praktiká. 

4️⃣ Tene kuenta ku e fasenan di desaroyo di mucha. 
 
5️⃣ Bai segun e ritmo di bo partisipantenan.

6️⃣ Bin prepará pa kada seshon. 

7️⃣ Hasi @global.prog_name un lugá dushi pa siña.

8️⃣ No tene miedu di dibertí!
note: The string @global.prog_name should not be translated.

SourceText:
In some programmes, facilitators tell participants what to do and why it is important. Participants are used to this because many education systems are delivered in a didactic, teacher-knows-best manner. 

In the @global.prog_name, we do things differently. We like to think of this as a collaborative approach to learning. As facilitators, we are **collaborators or partners** working with parents to identify plans and practice solutions that will help them to improve life at home.
**It is helpful to think of the participants as the experts.**
 
Many of the parents will already be practicing lots of positive ways of parenting with their children. Others will be able to identify ways of improving their parenting on their own with guidance. **Our job is to help parents learn for themselves how to achieve their goals.**
This sometimes means we have to work harder to ask the right sort of open-ended questions that will help participants work out the benefits of positive parenting and relationship building. **When participants are able to teach themselves on how to relate and behave, they learn a skill that will help them for a long time after the programme ends.**
text:
Den sierto programa, fasilitadónan ta bisa partisipantenan kiko pa hasi i dikon e ta importante. Partisipantenan ta kustumbrá ku esaki pasobra ta duna hopi sistema di edukashon na un manera didáktiko, kaminda ta e maestro sa mihó. 

Den @global.prog_name, nos ta hasi kosnan diferente. Nos ta mira esaki komo un aserkamentu di kolaborashon pa siña. Komo fasilitadó, nos ta **kolaboradó òf partner** traha ku mayornan pa identifiká plannan i praktiká solushonnan ku lo yuda nan mehorá bida na kas.
**Ta bon pa pensa riba e partisipantenan komo e ekspertonan.**

Hopi di e mayornan ya lo ta praktikando hopi manera positivo di edukashon familiar ku nan yunan kaba. Otronan lo por identifiká maneranan di mehorá nan edukashon familiar riba nan mes ku guia. **Nos trabou ta pa yuda mayornan siña pa nan mes kon pa logra nan metanan.**
Tin bia esaki ta nifiká ku nos mester traha mas duru pa hasi e tipo di preguntanan habrí korekto ku lo yuda e partisipantenan traha riba e benefisionan di edukashon familiar positivo i di konstruí relashon. **Ora partisipantenan por siña nan mes kon pa relashoná i komportá nan mes, nan ta siña un abilidat ku lo yuda nan pa hopi tempu despues ku e programa terminá.**
note: The string @global.prog_name, should not be translated.

SourceText:
The modelling principle is at the foundation of how we deliver the @global.prog_name. 
If we lead sessions in a collaborative approach, praise parents often, practice active listening (by acknowledging messages), and use positive instructions, parents will do the same with their children. Likewise, if we tell parents what to do, criticize them, ignore their needs or concerns, or only say what we do not want them to do, they will do the same.

Facilitators need to model all the different Core Principles in this programme. 

For example, when you praise your participants, do not add any buts, ifs, or any other criticisms! Use transition warnings. Give positive, specific instructions that say the behaviour you want to see in the participants. Some behaviours may need to be addressed directly such as participants being offensive to an individual or the group.

Use praise to encourage participants to arrive on time for sessions, to complete their home activities, and when they accomplish something very challenging. Practice Taking a Pause to help reduce your own stress.

The participants will learn from your example and begin to mirror your behaviour, too.

**It really works!**
text:
E prinsipio di duna ehèmpel ta forma e fundeshi di kon nos ta implementá @global.prog_name. Si nos guia seshonnan den un aserkamentu di kolaborashon, elogiá mayornan ku frekuensia, praktiká skuchamentu aktivo (dor di rekonosé e mensahe) i usa instrukshonnan positivo, mayornan lo hasi meskos ku nan yunan. Asina tambe, si nos bisa mayornan kiko pa hasi, kritiká nan, ignorá nan nesesidatnan òf preokupashonnan, òf solamente bisa loke nos no ke pa nan hasi, nan lo hasi meskos.

Fasilitadónan tin di duna ehèmpel di tur e diferente Prinsipionan Prinispal den e programa akí.

Por ehèmpel, ora bo ta elogiá bo partisipantenan, no agregá ningun 'pero', 'si', òf ningun otro krítika! Usa atvertensia di transishon. Duna instrukshonnan positivo i spesífiko ku ta indiká e komportashon ku bo ke mira den e partisipantenan. Lo mester atendé sierto komportashon direktamente manera ora ta trata partisipantenan ku ta ofensivo pa ku un individuo òf e grupo.

Usa elogio pa enkurashá partisipantenan pa yega na tempu pa seshonnan, pa kompletá nan aktividatnan na kas i ora nan logra algu hopi difísil. Praktiká Tuma un Pousa pa yuda redusí bo propio strès.

E partisipantenan lo siña for di bo ehèmpel i kuminsá reflehá bo komportashon tambe.

**E ta funshoná di bèrdat!**
note: The string @global.prog_name. should not be translated.

SourceText:
The @global.prog_name introduces many concepts and practices that are new to parents. Sometimes, participants will initially resist learning a new approach with their children. Other times, they will have difficulty understanding some of the more complex practices like distinguishing between punishment and discipline. Facilitators should always go at the participants’ pace when delivering the programme. 

Make sure that the participants in your group have learned a specific parenting or relationship building skill before moving on to the next one.
text:
E @global.prog_name ta introdusí hopi konsepto i práktika ku ta nobo pa mayornan. Tin bia, partisipantenan lo resistí na promé instante pa siña un aserkamentu nobo ku nan yunan. Otro bia, nan lo tin difikultat pa komprondé algun di e práktikanan mas kompleho manera distinguí entre straf i disiplina. Fasilitadónan semper mester bai segun e ritmo di e partisipantenan ora di fasilitá e programa.

Sòru pa e partisipantenan den bo grupo a siña un abilidat spesífiko di edukashon familiar òf di konstruí relashon promé ku pasa pa e siguiente.
note: The string @global.prog_name should not be translated.
